Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Theneed to rule is not the binary part of the mux, but its info.plist.
<dict>
<key>Name</key>
<string>AppleHDAController</string>
<key>Comment</key>
<string>Patch_to_not_load_this_driver</string>
<key>InfoPlistPatch</key>
<true/>
<key>Find</key>
<string>0x04020000</string>
<key>Replace</key>
<string>0x44220000</string>
</dict>
There's a complication here. The patch is supposed to be done in the kernelkesh, but if we make a
patch of info-plista to make the cupcake load, there is no such thing yet, because it is not yet
loaded.
In the audit 3154, and then in 3256 the info-plista patch is corrected (thanks to the user solstice).
Excluding all invisible characters, such as line translation and tabulation.
<dict>
<key>Comment</key>
<string>Power state 1 - 0</string>
<key>Name</key>
<string>AppleIntelHDGraphicsFB</string>
<key>InfoPlistPatch</key>
<true/>
<key>Find</key>
<data>PGtleT5Qb3dlclN0YXRlczwva2V5PjxpbnRlZ2VyPjE8L2ludGVnZXI+</data>
<key>Replace</key>
<data>PGtleT5Qb3dlclN0YXRlczwva2V5PjxpbnRlZ2VyPjA8L2ludGVnZXI+</data>
</dict>
If you have a sample confit with many patches, but in a particular case only apply a few, then
the superfluous can be prohibited
<key>Disable</key>
<true/>
It was very convenient to befound in the Property List Editor program, in which it is presented
simply by a tick. In Clover's 3990 audits, these patches can be allowed and banned from
Clover's menu by ticking this box.
Patching with Mask
Since the 5095 audit, the ability tomask binary patches has been introduced. This applies
to KextPatches, KernelPatches and BootPatches
I'll tell you in a separate place, keeping in mind all three points.
It looks like this (the specific data is unrealistic, just as a method.
So, in addition to the sixteen-line Find, we can also set the MaskFind mask, bit. If a bit is
1, we are looking for an exact match, if it is 0, we ignore the difference.
And for the Replace line, the MaskReplace mask means that the bits are a replacement, and we
leave it as it was.
Example:
92
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
1. Find all the lines in the specified cupcake, it also works in the core, or in boot.efi clever or
Clever. The difference in the first letter, it differs by a bit of 0x20. That is, we set the search mask
DF FF FF FF FF FF. This means that we are making upall bytes (letters) except the first one, in
which we ignore a large letter or a small one. This means that the unspecified bytes must be the
same
2. Replace the third letter with "o" in thefound words, meaning we'll get a clover or Clover,
respectively.
MaskReplace = 00 00 FF 00 00 00
The line can be cut to the right, because it is supposed to fill with zero. At the same time, those
bytes that we do not replace, it would be possible to not tell inReplace, but there is a requirement
of exact conformity of length.
To maintain the new Clover's backward compatibility with the old confit, it is assumed that the
unspecified mask (missing) consists of a FFFFFF, i.e. an accurate match to the search bar, and a
complete replacement of all bytes to specified.
Symbolic patching.
Since the 5119 audit, we have more search and patch capabilities. General
syntax
<dict>
<key>Comment</key>
<string>Symbolic patch example got lapic panic</string>
<key>MatchOS</key>
<string>All</string>
<key>Disabled</key>
<true/>
<key>Procedure</key>
<string>_lapic_interrupt</string>
<key>RangeFind</key>
<integer>200</integer>
<key>StartPattern</key>
<data>ACnHeAAx241H+oM=</data>
<key>MaskStart</key>
<data>/////wA=</data>
<key>Find</key>
<data>6AAA//+DAAAAAAAA</data>
<key>MaskFind</key>
<data>/wAA////AAAAAP//</data>
<key>Replace</key>
<data>6AAA//8xwJCQkJCQ</data>
<key>MaskReplace</key>
<data>/wAA////////////</data>
</dict>
MatchOS put All because we believe this method of patching is independent of the version of the
system.
Disabled is still true because this is an unrealistic example.
Procedure here write the name ofthe procedure, which we are looking for.
In general, the size of this procedure is simply the sizeof thesearch.
StartPattern was invented before the symbolic patch.
MaskStart is a mask for the starting point, that is for StartPattern.
93
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Beginning with the audit of 2814, it was possible to forcibly load cupcakes
<key>ForceKextsToLoad</key>
<array>
<string>\System\Library\Extensions\AppleHDA.kext</string>
</array>
Thus, the reluctance of cupcakes to load is overcome. It is necessary to sub load
IOXXXFamily, which is necessary to download the main muffin, but it depends on this last
name. For example, IONetworkFamily.
Or even a whole folder of "Extra"Extensions (revision 2816).
Notice the slope of the slush! To do this, you need a FSInject.efi driver.
<key>ATIConnectorsController</key>
<string>6000</string>
For the fulllaunch of Ati (AMD) Radeon 5000 and 6000 series, it is not enough to inject properties
into the registry, you still need to adjust the connectors inthe appropriatecontroller.
<key>ATIConnectorsData</key>
<string>00040000040300000001000021030204040000001402000000010000000004031000000010000000 0001000000000001</string>
<key>ATIConnectorsPatch</key>
<string>04000000140200000001000000000404000400000403000000010000110201050000000000000000 0000000000000000</string>
This method only works for systems 10.7 and above.
At 10.12, the connectors will be different, so this method should be considered obsolete,
although the methodof ic calculation is still the same.
I'll tell you more about how to get these numbers.
Original article from bcc9
http://www.insanelymac.com/forum/index.php?showtopic=249642
Full recipe from Xmedik in Russian language with discussions
http://www.applelife.com.au/threads/factory-ati-hd-6xxx-5xxx-
4xxx.28890/ Here I will set out shorter, tailored to the specifics of
KLover.
1. First of all, you need to get your video bios. Download CloverGUI and click F6. Your
Bios will be stored in the file /EFI/CLOVER/misc/c0000.bin, unless, of course, Clover is
installed in the section with the FAT32 file system.
2. Download the radeon_bios_decode program on one of these links. In the same folder with
this utility put a bios file c0000.bin. Let's say it's a folder of q/RadeonPatch Perform in
the terminal the following commands
cd ~/RadeonPatch
./radeon_bios_decode < c0000.bin
3. Youwon't get information on your connectors on the ekra that should be
copied/photographed for further use.
That's what I have.
iMac:test slice$ ./radeon_bios_decode <c0000.bin ATOM BIOS Rom:
94
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
SubsystemVendorID: 0x1458 SubsystemID: 0x2557 IOBaseAddress: 0xe000
Filename: R667D32I. F1 BIOS
Bootup Message:
GV-R667D3-2GI/F1
PCI ID: 1002:6758
Connector at index 0
Type [@offset 44282]: HDMI-A (11)
Encoder [@offset 44286]: INTERNAL_UNIPHY2 (0x21) i2cid
[@offset 44356]: 0x92, OSX senseid: 0x3
Connector at index 1
Type [@offset 44292]: DVI-D (3)
Encoder [@offset 44296]: INTERNAL_UNIPHY (0x1e) i2cid [@offset
44383]: 0x95, OSX senseid: 0x6
Connector at index 2
Type [@offset 44302]: VGA (1)
Encoder [@offset 44306]: INTERNAL_KLDSCP_DAC1 (0x15) i2cid
[@offset 44410]: 0x90, OSX senseid: 0x1
4. Download the script ati-personality.pl on one of the links
5. Put in the same folder, and run in the terminal perl ati-
personality.pl -386 zgt;frames.txt if you do it for a 32-bit
system, or
perl ati-personality.pl >frames.txt
for 64-bit.
Attention! In Sierra, the texts have changed, so the patch is system-dependent.
6. Now we need to decide on the choice ofthe suitable framework.
5000 series: mobil - Alouatta, desktop - Baboon 6000 series:
mobile - Cattail, desktop - Ipomoea 7000 series: mobile -
Pondweed, desktop - Futomaki.
7. For the selected framework, take a printout of connectors from our frames file.txt
received at step 5.
0000000
00
04
00 00
04 03
00
00 00
01 00 00
12
04
01
05
0000010 00 08 00 00 04 02 00 00 00 01 00 00
11 02
04
03
0000020 10 00 00 00 10 00 00 00 00 01 00 00
00 00
00
02
The numbers that need to be edited are highlighted in red. Blue numbers are just addresses,
you need to discard. The third digit from the end is encoderid, the last figure
— senseid. The first 4 digits in each line is the type
of monitor (more accurately, the type of connector).
ConnectorType
02
00
00
00
Lvds
04
00
00
00
DVI_DL(Dual Link)
00
02
00
00
DVI_SL(Single Link)
10
00
00
00
Vga
80
00
00
00
S-Video
00
04
00
00
Dp
95
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
00 08 00 00 HDMI
8. Senseid we got on step 3 for each of our connectors. encoder can just be in zeroed out
everywhere.
Here's the table:
0000000 04 00 00 00 04 03 00 00 00 01 00 00 10 00 01 06
0000020 10 00 00 00 10 00 00 00 00 01 00 00 00 00 00 01
0000010 00 08 00 00 04 02 00 00 00 01 00 00 12 00 04 03
That is, the first line DVI-D, the second line - VGA, the third - HDMI, and all with
my senseid values.
9. And a recipe from Sergey_Galan. http://www.applelife.ru/threads/mobility-ati-
radeon- hd5650m-hd5470m-hd4570m-hd4650m.29028/page-58#post-379044
The second digit from the end of HotPlugID should follow the order of 00, 01, 02. It affects
sleep and awakening. (highlighted in red)
0000000 04 00 00 00 04 03 00 00 00 01 00 00 10 00 00 06
0000020 10 00 00 00 10 00 00 00 00 01 00 00 00 00 01 01
0000010 00 08 00 00 04 02 00 00 00 01 00 00 12 00 02 03
10. Discarding the blue digits the rest enter into config.plist without gaps and line transfers.
The original table in ATIConnectorsData, after our edits to ATIConnectorsPatch.
11. I also saw a situation where the VGA connector was presented withredie connectors
like DVI-I (DVI-SL).
12. Recipe from eierfrucht https://applelife.ru/threads/sony-vaio-vpceb3m1r.522504/page-
3#post- 537081:
The most interesting thing is the bits of FEATURES at LVDS connector, I advise you to try
08 01, 08 00, 09 01 and 09 00, on one of them everything should start to wake up normally.
(Highlighted by Orange)
0000000 02 00 00 00 40 00 00 00 09 01 00 00 00 00 00 07
0000010 00 04 00 00 04 06 00 00 00 73 00 00 11 02 01 01
13. There,"Senseid LVDS panel to put 0x7", because Sony VAIO.
A new way to do this is to do so.

Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
We can alsoset binary patches for boot.efi or for kernel kernel.
<key>KernelToPatch</key>
<key>BootPatches</key>
For more information about masks, see Patching with Mask.
I want to note that this group of patches is practically not used by anyone, except the developers
themselves, in order to look for errors in severe cases, not obvious in external inspection. So we
were looking for hibernation problems, so we were looking for the moment when E2 was going to
thecore.
Devices
A group of settings for the rest of the PCI devices and tires in general.
<key>Inject</key>
<false/>
Put this value in true - the entire internal injection is replaced by the entry of a single line Of
Properties, which corresponds to the Apple Injection on the protocol APPLE_GETVAR_PROTOCOL
with THE 0x91BD12FE, 0xF6C3, 0x44FB, 0xA5, 0xB7, 0x51, 0x22, 0xAB, 0x30, 0x3A, 0xE0 And
used on real Macs. The old hackers called it EFIstrings.
<key>Properties</key>
<string>0207364862FA54HG345</string>
Obsolete! Starting with the 4497 audit, we do not make a line of 16 characters, but a dictionary
according to the rules of gfxutil.
<dict>
<key>PciRoot(0x0)/Pci(0x14,0x0)</key>
<dict>
<key>AAPL,clock-id</key>
<data>AA==</data>
<key>AAPL,current-available</key>
<data>sAQ=</data>
<key>AAPL,current-extra</key>
<data>vAI=</data>
<key>AAPL,current-in-sleep</key>
<data>6AM=</data>
<key>built-in</key>
<data>AA==</data>
<key>device_type</key>
<string>XHCI</string>
</dict>
<key>PciRoot(0x0)/Pci(0x19,0x0)</key>
<dict>
<key>built-in</key>
<data>AQ==</data>
</dict>
You can, for example, use DarwinDumper to see which plist generated Clover by default, that is,
make automaticine tots, or how you did the old way, load into the system, and in the system call in
the terminal
clover-genconfig >config-gen.plist
You're looking for a dictionary, and copying it into your config, and the old injecting
methods are turning it off. Only Clover understands a little more, he understands the zlt.- string,"lt.-
integer," zlt'gt;
97
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Today, clover-genconfig and plist editor are included in the Clover app.app. Use!
In principle, the same result is achieved by inserting methods of _DSM in DSDT, if it already
exists, and if you deal with its improvements. Who cares. Basically Properties are better than
_DSM, it is native to infused infused, and is triggered before the kernel starts.
<key>PCIRootUID</key>
<integer>0</integer>
It turns out that the injection of graphics card properties depends on how much is in
DevicePath'PciRoot (0x0) or PciRoot (0x1). However, at the dawn of the hackintheanization it
turned out that this number is just an ID spelled out in DSDT.
Device (PCI0)
{
Name (_HID, EisaId ("PNP0A08")) Name (_CID,
EisaId ("PNP0A03"))
Name (_ADR, Zero)
Name (_UID, Zero)
_UID- 0, if oneis equal, means 1.
Moreover, if this number is forcibly changed, it will change, and will work successfully. Now, the
real Macs always have 0. And accordingly boot.efi always assumes 0, so it is better if you correct
your DDD, Clover does it by default, and such ahatch in the confit is no longer.
<key>Audio</key>
<dict>
Inject
<key>Inject</key>
<string>887</string>
<key>ResetHDA</key>
<true/>
<key>AFGLowPowerState</key>
<true/>
</dict>
Installation of sound card properties. However, it only works if the device in DSDT is called
HDEF, if you do its renaming, then the rest can be otherwise injected. Also, these efforts are not
needed when using the VoodooHDA driver.
Options for the values are:
NO - nothing is injected, for example, if you inject properties through Properties
Detect is an automatic definition of an installed sound chip to use its ID as a leiout.
883 - in the decimal form of the leiout number. This is referring to The Realtek ALC883.
0x0373 - the same in 16-year form becomes unrecognizable.
In fact, these numbers are incorrect, the correct layout, for example, is 12 to 0x0C, but, oddly enough,
are valid.
With the advent of AppleALC, this option has taken on a new lease of life. Now it really is the
leiout number, and you need to select it from the list recommended for your sound codec. See the
documentation for this cupcake.
98
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
ResetHDA - If the sound chip is not turned on for some reason, this key can help with the initial
launch. It also affects Windowes. Necessity seen after the reboot from Windows to Mack.
AFGLowPowerState - affects the AppleHDA driver, and kind of has to solve the problem with
clicks in the speakers when you fall asleep/wakeup the soundsof the th pope.
<key>USB</key>
<dict>
Inject
<key>Inject</key>
<true/>
<key>AddClockID</key>
<true/>
<key>FixOwnership</key>
<true/>
<key>HighCurrent</key>
<true/>
</dict>
You can put falseif you somehow want to opt out of USB properties, for example, if you inject
properties through Properties.
FixOwnership
BIOS captures the control of the USB, and before the launch of the nucleus we have to tear the
USB from the BIOS. For UEFI download it is not like and not relevant, so by default it is turned on
for legasi-boot, and turned off for UEFI. It's relevant!
AddClockID
If you have such a property, the controller falls asleep dead, and does not wake up the computer.
If you want to wake up from the USB mouse, and put here false.
HighCurrent
Increasedcurrent on this USB controller, you need to charge the iPad, but I did not make such a
default.
A group of settings to camouflage their devices as native to OSX. (1971)
<key>FakeID</key>
<dict>
<key>ATI</key>
<string>0x67501002</string>
<key>IntelGFX</key>
<string>0x01268086</string>
<key>NVidia</key>
<string>0x0FE210DE</string>
<key>LAN</key>
<string>0x436311AB</string>
<key>SATA</key>
<string>0x25628086</string>
<key>WIFI</key>
<string>0x431214E4</string>
<key>XHCI</key>
<string>0x1E318086</string>
<key>IMEI</key>
<string>0x1E3A8086</string>
</dict>
In this group of settings, you can relabele your unsupported device into a supported device.
Examples:
99
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
–
AMDRadeonHD7850 has a DeviceID'0x6819, which is not backed by atI7000Controller
and ATIRadeonX3000 in the 10.8 system. There's support for DeviceID'0x6818. For it
to come into force it is required to somehow intrigue. There are two options for video
cards: either Inject--gt;ATI'true, or DsdtFixMask includes 0x0100 (FixDisplay).
–
The NVidia GTX660 has a DeviceID'0x1183, the card works in any way, but
AGPM is not provided for it.
–
The WiFi card in the Dell laptop is called Dell Wireless 1595, DeviceID'0x4315, in
reality it is Broadcom, which supports chips 4312, 4331, and a number of others.
–
The popular Marvell 80E8056 DeviceID'0x4353 network card doesn't work that way,
but works with the AppleYukon2 driver if you switch ID to 0x4363.
–
IMEI - This device works together with the Intel HD3000/4000, however, not the fact that
your chipset has the right ID.
SandyBridge = 0x1C3A8086
IvyBridge = 0x1E3A8086
Haswell = 0x8C3A8086
Works with the DSDT fix AddIMEI_80000 (AddIMEI)
This disguise works in two cases: with an injection, or with a DDDT patch. However, if we don't
want a full injection in the way Clover intended, then we can set the following property:
<key>NoDefaultProperties</key>
<true/>
In this case, the inject line is created, but does not yet contain any new properties.
Again, this is the way to make FakeID obsolete, better done through Properties following the way
You can add other properties, such asmodel, in the next array of Dictionaries!
<key>AddProperties</key>
<array>
<dict>
...
<key>Device</key>
<string>NVidia</string>
<key>Key</key>
<string>AAPL,HasPanel</string>
<key>Value</key>
<data>AQAAAA==</data>
</dict>
</array>
100
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Value can be a sixteen-line line. You just can't have a line. That is, instead of ABC.... you have to
write qlt'gt'0x414243....
Convert via PlistEditor orXcode.
The first Device key determines which device the property will be added to.
Ati
Nvidia
IntelGFX
LAN
WIFI
Firewire
SATA
IDE
HDA
HDMI
LPC
SmBUS
USB
Names should be exactly such, letter in letter. I don't think there's any need for clarification.
In this way, you can inject different properties for the analogue sound of Device'HDA, and for the
digital Device'HDMI. Clover will be, alas, not very correct, according to thevendor. It is envisaged
that with Intel graphics on HDMI output will use chipset HDA sound.
<key>UseIntelHDMI</key>
<true/>
This option affects the HDMI-transmitted properties and the DSDT patch. However, as far as I
know, the sound drivers that VoodooHDA, that AppleHDA, do not quite fully work with HDMI
outputom. According to new information, VoodooHDA only works with HDMI output NVIDIA,
and as for AMD, Apple in the systems 10.13 has created a new driver AppleGFXHDA.kext.
<key>HDMIInjection</key>
<false/>
Completely prohibit the injection of properties HDMI device.
Starting with the 3262 audit, a new way of injecting the properties of the devices is introduced not
by name, as it used to be, but by their location on the PCI bus. Here's a list that Clover gives out in
the booth log

Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128

Here we see two graphics cards and four USB UHCI devices. The type of device is identified
by its class of class- 040300 - is an HDA sound device.
Bus= 02

Function = 00
We use this value to inject properties out of date! Use
Properties!
<key>Arbitrary</key>

</array>

<key>Comment</key>
<string>Nvidia Geforce card in PCIe slot</string>

</array>
In this way, the Arbitrary section is an array of dictionaries, each matching the same device with a
given address, and the CustomProperties array of Key-Value pairs is used to describe each device.
Also, a specific itcan be turned off by a Disabled key.
You can dynamically turn the property on or off in Clover's menu.
Key should be a string of zlt'string'gt;
102
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Value can be a string, a number, or a data.
<key>ForceHPET</key>
<true/>
It turns out that there are still computers where the NRET is turned off by default, and there is no
tick to turn it on. This key will help (revision 2789)
<key>SetIntelBacklight</key>
<false/>
The key is entered in The Audit 3298. In the old systems, the brightness of the screenwas covered
with special IntelBacklight or ACPIBacklight cupcakes, in Captain they do not work, but it turned
out to be very easy to do it in Clover at the start stage of the system, and do not need an additional
cupcake, just put a trick from Ramalama and Rehabman.
And thedows are the keys.
<key>SetIntelMaxBacklight</key>
<true/>
The chip register will spell out the value from the following key:
<key>IntelMaxValue</key>
<integer>1808</integer>
or the default value most appropriate for this chip. Sherlock has introduced Clover to almost all
Intel chips, based on analysis ofdumps from infused.
<key>DisableFunctions</key>
<string>0x18F6</string>
This mask, which is superimposed in RCBA 0x3418 - exposes additional bits, banning some
devices in the Intel chipset. For very serious hackers.
<key>LANInjection</key>
<false/>
By default, the built-in property is being engineered for a networkcard.
RtVariables
The following two parameters have been introduced since the 980 audit and are designed to
allow registration in the iMessage service.
Starting with the audit of 1129 parameters are taken from THESIOS, and there is no
need. MLB = BoardSerialNumber
ROM is the latest SmUUID or Mac address.
<key>MLB</key>
<string>XXXXXXXXXX</string>
Numbers and letters, 17 characters long, meaning the serial number of the motherboard. There is no
regularity. Most reliable, take a real number, and swap withradish numbers, for example, write ...
SLICE... Who's got a fantasy.
<key>ROM</key>
<data>AAAAAAAA</data>
103
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Six pairs of 16-digits, often matching McKea's network card address. There are, however, reports
that the service works with arbitrary c ifrs.
And most importantly, registration in iMessage implies a paid service, you have to specify a real
bank card, from which you will be charged $1. Those who try to enter the sneer receive
messages like "Call Apple."
In 2015, the 10.11 ElCapitan system was introduced with new safety requirements. SIP
= System Integrity Protection. By default, protection is enabled and does not allow you to ship your
cupcakes and install their system utilities. To turn it off, Clover makes it possible to put new
pasmeters in NVRAM
<key>CsrActiveConfig</key>
<string>0x3E7</string>
<key>BooterConfig</key>
<string>0x28</string>
These are bit masks with possible bit values
/* Rootless configuration flags */
#define
CSR_ALLOW_UNTRUSTED_KEXTS
(1
<<
0)
#define
CSR_ALLOW_UNRESTRICTED_FS
(1
<<
1)
#define
CSR_ALLOW_TASK_FOR_PID
(1
<<
2)
#define
CSR_ALLOW_KERNEL_DEBUGGER
(1
<<
3)
#define
CSR_ALLOW_APPLE_INTERNAL
(1
<<
4)
#define
CSR_ALLOW_DESTRUCTIVE_DTRACE
(1
<<
5)
/* name deprecated
*/
#define
CSR_ALLOW_UNRESTRICTED_DTRACE
(1
<<
5)
#define
CSR_ALLOW_UNRESTRICTED_NVRAM
(1
<<
6)
#define
CSR_ALLOW_DEVICE_CONFIGURATION
(1
<<
7)
#define
CSR_ALLOW_ANY_RECOVERY_OS
(1
<<
8)
#define
CSR_ALLOW_UNAPPROVED_KEXTS
(1
<<
9)
#define CSR_ALLOW_EXECUTABLE_POLICY_OVERRIDE (1 << 10)
/* Bitfields for boot_args->flags */
#define kBootArgsFlagRebootOnPanic (1 << 0)
#define kBootArgsFlagHiDPI (1 << 1)
#define kBootArgsFlagBlack (1 << 2)
#define kBootArgsFlagCSRActiveConfig (1 << 3)
#define kBootArgsFlagCSRPendingConfig (1 << 4)
#define kBootArgsFlagCSRBoot (1 << 5)
#define kBootArgsFlagBlackBg (1 << 6)
#define kBootArgsFlagLoginUI (1 << 7)
The default values are the default to turn off the protection.
If, because of some paranoia, you need to turn on the protection, put the value 0 (zero).
The following three parameters are excluded, because they must be exhibited by the Clover Control
Panel system so that there is noonflik.
<key>MountEFI</key>
<string>Yes</string>
This option tells the start-up script that if you log in, you should mount the ESP (EFI System
Partition) section. This option for most people is unnecessary or temporary, it is worth in confitge to
prescribe No, and in the menu if necessary to put Yes.
Another possible value is disk1 if you have multiple discs, and each has its own EFI section.
<key>LogEveryBoot</key>
104
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
<string>Yes</string>
The download log is needed by the developers, and ordinary users can put No.
<key>LogLineCount</key>
<string>3000</string>
The number of lines in this log, then comes the displacing of old lines with new ones, so that there is no
unlimited p remainder ofthis file.
It's really not interesting to save up these logs. You can always get the last log by the team
$ bdmesg > ~/Desktop/boot-log.txt
DisableDrivers
<key>DisableDrivers</key>
<array>
<string>CsmVideoDxe</string>
<string>VBoxExt4</string>
</array>
The essence of this section is to have different config.plist in different OEM folders, but since the
drivers folder is shared, you have to somehow distinguish which set of drivers is used on a
particular configuration. On one, for example, you need OsxAptioFixDxe, the other needs
EmuVariableDxe.
Quirks
The history of this section is this. Start developing Clover for UEFI download
Dazar it was the development of a driver to adjust the memory, which is left behind by UEFI BIOS
Aptio (American Megatrend). Conflict doesn't just affect memory, it's still boot.efi debarks
virtualization of addresses, and it affects pointers, function and so on.
I note that this problem was not with Legasy Clover, because in this case Allocate from
EDK2 is used, and it allocates memory from top to bottom.
For a long time after dmazar's departure, no one was referring to this driver, except
maybesome single-line additives like Free2000.But there's also a ReddestDream programmer
who decided to separate all of these developments from OpenCore into a separate driver,
Oc'uyrks.efi, which works in conjunction with the OpenRuntime.efi driver, and all the settings
are recorded in the Oc's file to use all of this with the Clover loader.
And then my move. I need to have all the sourceand in one repo, so that it is possible to do
bisection.
105
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
That is, if you can not immediately load, you can try to go into this menu and change some
installation yes-no.
Now the details about each item. The defaults are set.
<key>AvoidRuntimeDefrag</key>
<true/>
Prevents memory defragmentation for runtime-services, such as NVRAM support.
<key>DevirtualiseMmio</key>
<false/>
Removes runtime from some of the known mmIO areas. Not recommended for systems older
than Sandy Bridge. However, according to my observations, the list of known regions can still
be supplemented in the mmioWhitelist picks section.
<key>MmioWhitelist</key>
<array/>
The list of regions is set as an array of dictionaries
<dict>
<key>Comment</key>
It's such a region.
<key>Address</key>
<string>0xffe00000</string>
<key>Enabled</key>
<true/>
</dict>
<key>DisableSingleUser</key>
<false/>
Prohibit the use of command line mode because it is not safe. ;)
106
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
<key>DisableVariableWrite</key>
<false/>
Prohibits access from MAKOS to NVRAM by record, for security.
<key>DiscardHibernateMap</key>
<false/>
When waking upand out of hibernation use an old memory card.
<key>EnableSafeModeSlide</key>
<true/>
By default, downloading in safe mode gives slide-0. This patch allows youto use another value set
in the ProvideCustomSlide pickaxe.
<key>ProvideCustomSlide</key>
<false/>
Or not, to use an automatic calculation of the slide value. The need is visible from the log if there is
a message OCABC: Only N/256 slide values are usable!
<key>ProvideMaxSlide</key>
<integer>0</integer>
The value is 1 to 254, for the case above. 255 is the default, and this can lead to memory allocation
errors.
<key>EnableWriteUnprotector</key>
<true/>
Removes a bit of recording protection in the Runtime services page. Due to the insecurity of this
pickaxe there is another RebuildAppleMemoryMap. That is, for systems older than 2018 put
EnableWriteUnprotector - True
RebuildAppleMemoryMap - False SyncRuntimePermissions
— False
And for newer, supportive MATS, if there is such a table ACPI in BIOS
EnableWriteUnprotector - False RebuildAppleMemoryMap -
True SyncRuntimePermissions - True
<key>ForceExitBootServices</key>
<false/>
Repeat with the new MemoryCards.
<key>ProtectMemoryRegions</key>
<false/>
Changes the attributes of some regions when there is a conflict between the concepts of macos and
BIOS. This pick includes several fixes, including one developed personally by me, one that protects
the CSM region. In particular, if your graphics card does not have UEFI VBIOS, this pick should be
included.
<key>ProtectSecureBoot</key>
<false/>
107
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Protects encryption keys from rewriting the operating system. The need for this pickaxe is
observed on some INsyde BIOS.
<key>ProtectUefiServices</key>
<false/>
Some BIOS, such as VMware, are trying to rewrite pointers on Runtime services.
<key>ProvideConsoleGopEnable</key>
<true/>
Creates a GOP protocol for console mode, that is, that the conclusion of thoseksta was not in text
mode, as used to do in PC BIOS, but in graphic, as Apple does.
<key>RebuildAppleMemoryMap</key>
<false/>
The fact is that Apple has a few differentideas about how and what to do than in our UEFI BIOS.
The problem, however, is that our memory card corresponds to our iron. So we turn off the picks.
This pick kind of replaces EnableWriteUnprotector for MAT support systems.
Also, this pick also requires the inclusion of SyncRuntimePermissions.
<key>SetupVirtualMap</key>
<true/>
Kirk is dealing with the way virtual addresses are assigned and used. Some BIOS, such
as OVMF, do not support this pickaxe. So let's turn it on.
<key>SignalAppleOS</key>
<false/>
Bios informs us that we are loading the MACS system, even though weare Mr. Windows.
<key>SyncRuntimePermissions</key>
<true/>
Updates runtime permit flags. Of course you do.
The general situation is that for my not very newto the umputers it was these default installations
that were sufficient.
In Clover 5125, new values appeared in this section due to the inclusion of patches from OpenCore.
<key>FuzzyMatch</key>
<false/>
108
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
The key provides compatibility with the system 10.6 (Snow Leopard), where they say, the control
amount of cache is considered in a different way. I don't know how OpenCore is, and Clover's been
loading Snow for a long time, and at the same time.
<key>KernelCache</key>
<string>Auto</string>
Possible values (Auto, Cacheless, Mkext, Prelinked). These types of caches were up to the system
10.7 and was usually chosen using the Kernel, Mkext and others that existed in the old Clover.
<key>AppleXcpmExtraMsrs</key>
<false/>
Support XCPM for the extra CPU, something that the KernelXCPM patch used to do.
<key>AppleXcpmForceBoost</key>
<false/>
This patch records 0xFF00 in the register MSR_IA32_PERF_CONTROL 0x199, that is,
instead of normal p-states, Opencore proposes to drive the maximum step.
<key>DisableIoMapper</key>
<true/>
Turns off VT-d technology in its own way. There is an alternative to discard the DMAR table. And
then there's the dart-0 option.
<key>DisableLinkeditJettison</key>
<true/>
Lets Lilu.kext run faster. Due to what is unknown. You don't need any more, you don't need to
keepyms.
<key>DisableRtcChecksum</key>
<false/>
The bottom line of the patch is that the RTC in The Mac is not used the way in the PC, and the control
amount will be bad. We'regoing toblock it in a simple way. In Clover there is an analogue of
AppleRTC'YES, and we use it.
<key>DummyPowerManagement</key>
<false/>
Blocks AppleIntelCpuPowerManagement as an alternative to NullCPUPM cupcake. I remind you
that the cupcake is blocked mainly if OxE2 is blocked, and there are other patches against it.
<key>ExternalDiskIcons</key>
<false/>
The long-known patch against yellow icons is framed as a pickaxe.
<key>IncreasePciBarSize</key>
<false/>
IOPCIFamily increases the memory value for the bar from 1 to 4GB. OpenCore does not
recommend it at all.
<key>PowerTimeoutKernelPanic</key>
<false/>
This patch, only for Catalina, prevents the core from panicking if a device does not ignite for a long
time. Why cancel it?!
109
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
<key>ThirdPartyDrives</key>
<false/>
A long-known patch is in Clover's confit, Enable Trim on Non-Apple. There is also a comment
that there are internal opportunities in Catalina to do the same.
<key>XhciPortLimit</key>
<true/>
The well-known problem is that Apple limits the number of XHCI, USB2-USB3 ports to 15, and
even though the new chipsets give more ports, Apple is in no hurry to increase this limit. Binary
patches have been around for a long time, but they depend on the version of the system. I don't
know Legacy_USB how far the Opencore managed to overcome the dependence on the version.
Acpi
A group of parameters governing the correction of different ACPI tables.
And the fact is not only that Mack has its own requirements, but also just different versions of the
APPI specification, and the elementary laziness of manufacturers, and just in the BIOS system
board there is no information about the installed maps and the CPU (and dynamically determine
weakly? Clover does it!).
FADT table options
<key>ResetAddress</key>
<string>0x64</string>
<key>ResetValue</key>
<string>0xFE</string>
These two parameters serve as one very valuable fix - a restart fix. These values should be in the
FADT table, but for some reason they are not always there, moreover, there is a table shorter than
necessary, so that these values have beendiscarded.
Practice has shown that it doesn't work for everyone, Another possible pair of values 0x0CF9/0x06,
which means restart through the PCI bus.
<key>HaltEnabler</key>
<true/>
And this fixes the problem of turning off/going to sleep at UEFI-loading. The fix is made once, before
calling boot.efi, so 100% efficiency is not guaranteed. Nevertheless, it issafe enough, at least on Intel
chipsets.
<key>smartUPS</key>
<false/>
110
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
In fact, this option is designed to be used to write a feed profile in the FADT table. The logic is:
PM'1 - desktop, powered by the network
PM'2 - notebook, powered by network or battery
The PM'3 is a server powered by SmartUPS, which MacOSX also knows something about.
The choice between 1 and 2 Clover will make based on the analysis of the bit of mobility, but there
is also a Mobile option in the SMBIOS section.
MADT Adjustment (APIC)
<key>PatchAPIC</key>
<false/>
Some computers can only download the system with cpus/1, or with a special patched core (Lapic
NMI patch). The simplest analysis showed that they had the wrong MADT table, namely, it did not
contain sections of NMI. However, I have not seen reports that someone helped with something.
Yes, there is a developer who needs it, and who bythe rules of this patch in the new versions of
Clover.
There is an appropriate patch in the KernelAndKextPatches section, too, to solve this problem, but
by other means.
Other APCs tables:
<key>DropTables</key>
<array>
<dict>
<key>Signature</key>
<string>DMAR</string>
</dict>
<dict>
<key>Signature</key>
<string>MCFG</string>
</dict>
<dict>
<key>Signature</key>
<string>SSDT</string>
<key>TableId</key>
<string>CpuPm</string>
<key>Length</key>
<string>0x0fe1</string>
</dict>
</array>
In this array, we list the tables we want to discard.
DMAR - because Mac is not friends with VT-d technology. MCFG - because by setting the
MacBookPro or MacMini model we get the hard brakes. A more correct method has already
beeninvented.
<key>FixMCFG</key>
<true/>
At the same time, the table is not discarded, but adjusted. The author of the patch again
vit9696. However, the method of discarding this table is still in reserve.
Back to the story of DropTables
SSDT are different, and we specify additional TableId, which will be discarded, because we are
going to generate their SSDT tables, built according to Apple rules, and
111
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
not Gigabyte, or, god forgive me, ASUS. You can see it in the title of the table, or in Clover's booth
log. Here, for example, is a table that should not be discarded.
DefinitionBlock ("SSDT-0.aml," "SSDT," 1, "SataRe," "SataTabl,0x000010000) In this case, the saved
tables will be subject to the rule for binary patches DSDT, that is, these tables will also be
modified, which is logical.
If all SSDT tables for some reason have the same TableID, you can specify the length of the
table that you wantto jerk off.
as a decimal number.
<key>DisableASPM</key>
<false/>
This affects the settings of the ACPI system itself, such as the fact that Apple control ASPM does
not work as we have. For example, a non-native chipset. When you need to apply, and what it
affects I do not remember.
<key>SSDT</key>
<key>DropOem</key>
<true/>
Since we're going to create or load our SSDT tables dynamically, we need to avoid unnecessary
intersections of interests. This option allows you to discard all native tables in favor of new ones.
(fu!) uncorrected tables discard. It is better, however, to take advantage of the above method of
selective Dropa.
<key>Generate</key>
<dict>
<key>CStates</key>
<true/>
<key>PStates</key>
<true/>
</dict>
Here we determine that two additional tables for C-states and P-states, according to the rules
developed by the hack community, will be generated.
For C-states, tablesand based on the parameters C2, C4, C6, Latency mentioned in the CPU section.
<key>EnableC7</key>
<true/>
<key>EnableC6</key>
<true/>
<key>EnableC4</key>
<false/>
<key>EnableC2</key>
<false/>
<key>C3Latency</key>
<integer>67</integer>
The fact that this generation has entered into force is controlled by the kernel-log. Without this method
there is an error ACPI_SMC_PlatformPlugin::p ushCPU'CSTData - _CST evaluation failed .
"C-States. And it also depends on the chipset, whether your chipset will respond adequately to
112
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
C-State team from Makos. The easiest option is not to write this option, everything will work and
so.
For P-states, the table complements the processor section with _PPC, _PCT and _PSS methods.
_PCT - Performance Control - control of speedstep control.
_PPC - Performance Present Capabilities - speedstep capabilities, Thisfeature returns one number,
which means frequency limitation.
_PSS - Performance Supported States - a set of possible CPU states - P-states. This array is formed
based on the data about the processor that Clover has already calculated, as well as taking into
account the user's parameters:
<key>PLimitDict</key>
<string>1</string>
The essence of the option is very simple - to limit the maximum frequency of the processor. Value
0 - work to the maximum, 1 - one step less than the maximum, 2 - on two steps. Example: The
Core2Duo T8300 2400MHz works at a maximum frequency of 2000 if limited toa level 2000.
Why would you do that? Yes, so that the laptop does not overheat, there the capabilities of the CPU
far exceed the ability to cool. Exactly the same option is present in plista platforms, such as:
System/Library/Extensions/IOPlatformPluginFamily.kext/Contents/PlugIns/ACPI_SMC_PlatformPlugin.kext/Contents
/Resources/MacBook5_1.plist
Next, we will discuss these plists.
For some processors, such as Core2'u', it's noted that PlimitDict works the other way around, and
the best option is the one. It is possible that this is just a mistake in the DDDT. For example,
because they did not want to make a Darwin patch
<key>UnderVoltStep</key>
<string>1</string>
An additional option to lower the CPU's temperature by reducing its working voltage. Possible
values 0, 1, 2, 3 ... The more, the stronger aboutthe cooling, until the computer hangs.
<key>DoubleFirstState</key>
<true/>
It is found that for a successful speedstep you need to duplicate the first state in the P-states table.
After the introduction of other pairsof etrov the need for this became doubtful.
<key>MinMultiplier</key>
<integer>7</integer>
Minimum processor multiplier. He himself reports that he is 16, and prefers to work at 1600,
however, for a speedstep should be set in the table of states down to 800 or even 700.
<key>MaxMultiplier</key>
<integer>30</integer>
113
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Introduced by analogy with minimal, but seems to be in vain. It's not worth writing in. However, it
somehow affects the number of P-states, so you can experiment, however, without much need it is
not necessary to do it.
<key>Generate</key>
<dict>
<key>CStates</key>
<true/>
<key>PluginType</key>
<false/>
<key>APLF</key>
<false/>
<key>APSN</key>
<false/>
<key>PStates</key>
<true/>
</dict>
In the new Clover, this group of settings is merged into one section, and PluginType is
now just true or false. Because there are no other vants. APLF and APSN options kind of affect
the speedstep, but for those who know what they're for.
<key>PluginType</key>
<integer>0</integer>
For IvyBridge processors, Haswell (and above?) need to bet 1, for the remaining 0.
This key, in conjunction with the Generate→PluginType key, allows you to generate an SSDT table that
contains only PluginType but does not contain P-States if their generation is disabled.
A large section on the setting and patches of DSDT.
<key>DSDT</key>
<dict>
<key>Debug</key>
<false/>
this option allows you to see what happens to DSDT during its patch, if wecan't download the system
after that.
/EFI/CLOVER/ACPI/origin/DSDT-or.aml, then the procedure of all patches is done (by the
way it leaves a lot of messages in the debug.log, if it is also connected), and then the file is stored
/EFI/CLOVER/ACPI/origin/DSDT-pa0.aml, if such a file already exists on a previous attempt,
the next number DSDT-pa1.aml, DSDT- pa2.aml... , they will not rewrite each other.
<key>Name</key>
<string>DSDT.aml</string>
You may have multiple versions of the DSDT file with arbitrary names, or you can write a non-
existent name, such as the standard BIOS.aml, and then the DSDT that is available in BIOS will be
taken as a basis. Priority trailfiles:
1. The highest priority is the DSDT.aml file, which is the root of the downloadable
system.
2. If there is no such file, look for a flash drive in the OEM section:
/EFI/CLOVER/OEM/p8b/ACPI/patched/DSDT.aml
114
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
3. If there isn't, we'll look in the folder
/EFI/CLOVER/ACPI/patched/DSDT.aml
<key>FixMask</key>
<string>0xFFFFFFFF</string>
Under this parameter hides at once 32 patches for the table DSDT, by the number of bits in the
mask.
To calculate how the amount of bits folds into a particular mask, you can call a system calculator,
translate it into a kind for a programmer, and switch it to 16-date numbers. And now by clicking on
the bits from 0 to 31, we'll get the right mask.
There is a more visual version: CloverFixDsdtMaskCalculator by Cvad
http://www.applelife.ru/attachments/cloverfixdsdtmaskcalculator-app-zip.43973/
Starting withp.e.g., 2184 patches can (and should) be broken in the next section

<key>ReuseFFFF</key>

original DDDT
Device (PEGP)
{
Name (_ADR, 0xFFFF)
Name (_SUN, One)
}
It can be changed to 0, but it does not always work. We're going to change the address, we'regoing

to leave and we're not trying to patch it.

<key>DropOEM_DSM</key>

In some cases, the device we want to automatically patch already has an OEM method _DSM.
You can't duplicate, so there are two options:
The original method will be thrown back, and ours is generated instead,
When we meet the original method, we retreat without doing anything.
What's in the original method? Yes hardly what we would like to see, and hardly what is needed for
OSX. Typically, BIOS manufacturers only think about Windows.
If you thinkSo I would recommend drop all of these OEM DSM, except for the option when
you put your custom DDD on it and apply more auto-omatic fixes to it,but youdon't want to
change your _DSM to your auto-omatic methods.
In my new computer DDDT turned out to be insanely bad in terms of macOS. It has many
DSM methods, both in the parent device and in the daughters. The result is a panica.
DropOEM_DSM's powerless here. Helped the next kind patch
Patches → find :_DSM, replace: ZDSM. Cm. Below.
<key>SuspendOverride</key>
<false/>
The shuttle patch only works on a type 5- shutdown state, however, we may want to extend this patch to
states 3 and 4, we put SuspendOverride true.
It helped me with going to sleep at UEFI-loading. Otherwise, the screen was
extinguished, and the light bulbs and fans continued to work.
More advanced hackers can make their own DSDT patches using a bin-level replacement:
<key>Patches</key>
<array>
<dict>
119
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
<key>Find</key>
<data>UFhTWAhfQURSAAhfUFJXEgYC</data>
<key>Replace</key>
<data>UFhTWAhfQURSAAhfU1VOCgQIX1BSVxIGAg==</data>
<key>TgtBridge</key>
<data>UFhTW</data>
</dict>
<dict>
<key>Comment</key>
<string>Rename oem _DSM to ZDSM</string>
<key>Disabled</key>
<false/>
<key>Find</key>
<data>
X0RTTQ==
</data>
<key>Replace</key>
<data>
WkRTTQ==
</data>
</dict>
</array>
TgtBridge determines that the patch will only work within one block defined by that name
Device (RP02) { .. }
however, this method is inaccurate because the blocks are fragmented, it is better to use
the renameDevices method (below)
Specific numbers are yours, from your developments, if you know what to do. Thelength of the
strings may not be the same, Clover will correctly consider the length change, with one exception: to
prevent it from happening inside the If or Else statement.
Some explanations. The Comment key is not a reminderto you that it is written here, it is also
used in Clover's menu to compile a menu to connect/disable these fixes. The default is allowed.
If you have someone else's set of patches, it is better to first prescribe them as Disabled'true, and
then in the menu to allow them one at a time.
Other ACPI tables
Clover has a service for loading other tables. In particular, it is very common to manufacture a
whole library of different SSDT-xxx.aml for different devices and for speedstep. Since the revision
of 3088, the rule of loading such tables has changed.
Tables put inapka
/EFI/CLOVER/OEM/xxx/ACPI/patched/
if there is no such folder, the shared folder is considered
/EFI/CLOVER/ACPI/patched/
All files with the ".aml" extension that do not start with the "." point and do not contain the "DSDT"
line in their name will be loaded,sweating that the DSDT of one of the different variants is loaded
on another algorithm.
The download order is not guaranteed. If we want a strictly defined download order, we have to
write this explicitly in a confit
<key>ACPI</key>
<dict>
<key>SortedOrder</key>
<array>
<string>SSDT-3.aml</string>
120
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
<string>SSDT-1.aml</string>
<string>SSDT-2.aml</string>
</array>
And if such an array is present, only these tables will be loaded, and strictly in this order.
Another problem with the tables is the name. OEM does not shy away from using the national
alphabet, nor just the lack of a name, but for Apple it is unacceptable.
<key>FixHeaders</key>
<true/>
The same fix was in the DSDT Fixes section, but since it is not dSDT, it is made in a separate
paragraph of the ACPI section.
<key>RenameDevices</key>
<dict>
<key>_SB. PCI0. RP02. PSXS</key>
<string>ARPT</string>
<key>_SB. PCI0. EHC1</key>
<string>EH01</string>
<key>_SB. PCI0. POP2. PEGP</key>
<string>GFX0</string>
</dict>
Unlike acPI binary patches, which, incidentally, act not only on DSDT, but also on SSDT, both
native and downloadable, this method serves as a replacementfor the typeof patch
Find->PXSX, Replace->ARPT. But if in the section DSDT-'gt'gt;Patches such replacement operates
on the entire space, in the method renameDevices the algorithm will look only for those devices
that lie on the specified bridge.
This is a complex example to replace _SB. PCI0. RP02. PSXS → ARPT Scope(\_SB)
{
Device (PCI0)
{
Device(RP02)
{
Device (PSXS)
{
Method(_ON)
{
}
Method(_OFF)
{
}
}
PSXS._ON ()
}
Scope(RP02)
{
PSXS._OFF ()
}
Device(RP03)
{
Device (PSXS) - don't change here
{
}
PSXS._ON () is not to be changed here
}
121
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
DSDT adjustment
DSDT - Differentiated System Description Table is the largest and most complex APPI table. The
minimum length is 36 bytes, the real one is 20kb or more. This table describes devices and how to
access them. Access methods can contain arithmetic and logicalexpressions, and thus represent a
program in a kind of programming language similar to C of their curly braces.
And why do you need to fix it? The fact is that the OSX system has a cupcake
AppleIntelCPUPowerManagement, which serves to control the power of the processor (speedstep),
and which strictly needs the system to have an HPET that has an interruption of ir.
You can only work by banning, or removing this cupcake. But there is another option - to adjust
the DSDT, and the HPET device will turn on as it should be! However, in the system 10.9 the
requirements were changed. Nonsense! Patch is still needed, and has the same power.
This is patch number 1,a vital necessity. Is McOs the only one who needs this NRT? No, of
course, but the manufacturers of BIOS are just beginning to realize this and prescribe the right
parameters, until now rarely meet that DSDT worked without a patch.
Moment 2. In DDDT you can see some dependence on the operating system,Windows98,
Windows 2001, Windows 2006, Linux, MAKOS has a "Darwin" ID, and usually it is not designed
for DDT. MacOSX is a serious ACPI system, i.e. uses DDDT for the maximumof the u as well as it is
used byWindows 2001, but not Linux, not Windows 98, and not Windows 2006. On many BIOS
this is appropriateto the value ofOSYS q 0x07D2. But not 0x2410, as it is prescribed in the
nativist. We need to look at the algorithm.
On my Skylake 2017 the best value was 0x7DA. That'FixDarwin7_10000 s why Ihave 0x7D9, and
it affects usb3.0, why did BIOS decide to turn it off for WindowsXP.
Moment 3. The manufacturer of the system board, and with it and his BIOS, and its DDDT,
can not foresee what processor will be installed, what graphics card and other PCI setup.
Conversely, to exclude from DDDT such devices as speaker, floppy drive, parallel port.
DSDT is in BIOS and is used in the system in the binary code AML, there is a
compiler/decomplin IASL, which translates codes into a language understandable to humans
122
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Dsl. And then there is the moment No.4. In the process of editing, it is necessary to correct
them. (It's strange, but compilation/decompilation are not strictly reverse operations,
back and forth changes the table, or even ingeneral, goes there, back and forth no - intervention is
required. Looking from my bell tower, this means that the decompinator is written with
errors, such programmers have worked on it.
When we've come all this way, we can put our corrected DSDT to the downloader by
putting it in the folder /EFI/CLOVER/XXX/ACPI/patched, or, if OEM the name of the computer
is not yet known, into the folder /EFI/CLOVER/ACPI/patched, or the downloadable system itself
has its own version of DCD.
Where to get the original DDDT that needs to be patched?
Be patient if the save is on a flash drive, and the tables are many, the process may take a
noticeable time. To do this, in Clover's interface, enterm in Options Menu, change the DSDT
mask, then leave the menu and press F5. Clover will save your DDDT, corrected to the current
mask, with a name such as DSDT-F597.aml, ie. patched with a mask 0xF597. You can make
several options to then compare.
Now you can take the DSDT file and edit... And for those who are not strong in
the asl language, Clover suggests making some fixes automatically.
Yes, DDDT is a set of descriptions and methods, many of which we do not need. Clover doesn't touch
them, even if we put the maximum mask on. Errors can be heldin places untouched, and they remain
there.
Let's take a closer look at the fixes. In the 4300 audit, the description of the fixes was simplified.
AddDTGP bit(0):
To describe the properties of the device, in addition to the DeviceProperties variant
discussed above, there is an option with the _DSM method prescribed in DSDT.
_DSM - Device Specific Method - is well known for this method, which works in MacOSX starting
in version 10.5, this method contains an array describing the device and a challenge to the universal
DTGP method, which is the same for all devices.
This fix simply adds this method ton oth it to apply to other fixes. I saw the advice to put a
mask 0x31, they say, the rest of the fixes are not needed.
FixDarwin bit(1):
Mimicry OS Darwin under the Windows XP system. Many sleep problems and withI'm
growing feet out of a misidentification system.
123
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
FixDarwin7 bit(16)
Similarly, only mimicry under the Windows 7 system. In the old DDDT there may not be a
check under such a system. You have options.
FixShutdown bit(2):
The TS _P featureis added to the condition: if the argument is 5 (off), then no other action
should be done. However, there is repeated confirmation of the effectiveness of this patch for the
ASUS boards, maybe for others.
AddMCHC bit(3):
Such a 0x060000 device is usually not available in DSDT, but for some chipsets this device
is serviced and therefore needs to be prescribed to properly dilute the power management of the PCI
tire. The question of the needfor a patch is solved experimentally.
FixHPET bit(4):
As already said, this is the main fix necessary.
Thus, the minimally needed DDDT patch mask looks like 0x0010
FakeLPC bit(5):
Replaces DeviceID LPC controller to make the AppleLPC cupcake cling to it.
It is needed for those cases where the chipset is not provided for OSX (e.g. ICH9). However,
the home list of Chipsets Intel and NForce is so large that the need for such a patch is very rare.
Although, this is not a fact either. It happens that the cupcake itself is unloaded from memory for
lack of need, although the chipset is supported.
FixIPIC bit(6):
Removes interruption from IPIC device. This fix affects the Power key (a popping
window with Reset, Sleep, Shutdown variants).
FixSBUS bit(7):
Adds SMBusController to the device tree, thereby removing the warning that it is missing
from the system log. And it also creates the right tire power control wiring, it also affects sleep.
FixDisplay bit(8):
Makea number of patches_DSM for the graphics card. (1974)
Patches for all graphics cards, only for non-Intel. For the built-in Intellectuals is another bit.
FIX_INTELGFX_100000
Also added is the HDMI device (HDAU) if necessary.
124
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
FixIDE bit(9):
In the system 10.6.1 there was panic on the AppleIntelPIIXATA cupcake. Two ways to solve
the problem - the use of a corrected muffin, or fix the device in the DDDT. And for more modern
systems? Let it be if there is such a controller.
FixSATA bit(10):
Fifixes some problems with SATA, and removes the yellowness of disk icons in the system
by mimicry under ICH6. Actually controversial method, but without this fix I have DVDs are not
lost, and la DVD drive should not be removable.
There is an alternative, solved by the addition of a fix with a cupcake AppleAHCIport.kext.
See the chapter about the cupcake patch.
And, accordingly, this bit can not be put! One of those few bits that I recommend not to bet.
FixFirewire bit(11):
Adds a "fwhub" property to the Firewire controller if it is. If not, nothing will happen. You
can bet if you don't knowif you need to or not.
FixUSB bit(12):
Trying to solve numerous USB problems. For the XHCI controller, when using native or
patched IOUSBFamily, such a DSDT patch is irreplaceable.
Apple driver specifically uses ACPI, and the DSDT should becorrect.
FixLAN bit(13):
The "built-in" property for the network card is necessary for the correct
operation. Also injected is a model of the card - for cosmetics.
FixAirport bit(14):
Similarly, LAN also creates the device itself, if not yet registered in DSDT. For some
well-known models, DeviceID is replaced with supported. And the airport is turned on without
other patches.
FixHDA bit(15):
Adjusting the description of the sonic tothe art point in the DDD to work the native
driver of AppleHDA.
FixRTC
Removes interruption from the device _RTC. It is necessary, and very strange, that someone
If there is no such interruption in the original interruption, then this patch will not do anything
terrible. only single bank...
Do not know what is wrong with this message, it can be excluded if the length put 8. But in this
case there will be a risk of getting a bios reset after sleep. Therefore, an additional key is introduced
to solve this trick:
<key>ACPI</key>
<dict>
<key>DSDT</key>
125
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
<dict>
<key>Rtc8Allowed</key>
<false/>
</dict>
true - the length of the region will remain 8 bytes, if there was one,
false - will be corrected to 2 bytes, which more reliably protects against the reset of CMOS.
As the region's vit9696 has been studied, it is still necessary to leave8, because it is needed to preserve
the hibernation key.
FixTMR
Similarly, it removes an interruption from the timer _TMR. It's out of date and Macom isn't
used.
AddIMEI
The required patch for SandyBridge and above is to add an IMEI device to the device tree if
it wasn't there yet.
FixIntelGfx
The patch for the built-in Intel graphics is separated from the rest of the graphics cards, that is,
you can put an injection for Intel and not put for Nwedia.
FixWAK
Adds Return to the _WAK method. It must be, but for some reason it is often not contained
by the DDDT. Apparently the authors adhered to some other standards. In any case, this fix is
completely safe.
DeleteUnused
Removes unused floppy-type devices. What would you be worried about?
In fact, CRT and DVI devices are still being removed here - a perfectly necessary condition for the
launch of IntelX3100 on Dell laptops. Otherwise, the black screen, checked by hundreds of uselei.
FixADP1
Corrects the ADP1 device (power supply) that is necessary for the laptop to sleep properly
when it is plugged into the socket, or when it is taken out of it.
AddPNLF
Inserts the device PNLF (Backlight), which is necessary to properly control the brightness
of the ekwound, and, oddly enough, helps to solve the problem with sleep, including for the
desktop.
FixS3D
Similarly, this patch solves a sleep problem.
FixACST
Some DSDT has a device, or method, or variable named ACST, but this name is used by
MacOSX 10.8 to control c-state.
126
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
conflict with very obscure behavior. This fix renames all the occurrences of such a name into
something safe.
Can't figure out how you can ignore this series of patches?! Don't you needa well-functioning
computer?
AddHDMI
Adds an HDAU device to the DSDT that matches HDMI to the ATI or Nvidia graphics
card. It is clear that once the card was bought separately from the motherboard, then in the native
DSDT such a device simply does not exist. In addition, the device is injected with the property
hda-gfx'onboard-1 or onboard-2 due to the circumstances:
-1 if UseIntelHDMI'false
-2 if there is an Intell port, which occupied port 1.
FixRegions
And this is a very special patch. If the rest of the patches were intended for editing BIOS.aml,
to create a good DSDT out of nothing, then this fix is designed for the final yusting of a well-
made custom DSDT.aml, and for BIOS.aml it is useless.
There are regions in DDDT that have their addresses, such as:
OperationRegion (GNVS, SystemMemory, 0xDE6A5E18, 0x01CD)
The problem is that the address of this region is created by BIOS dynamically, and it can be
different from download to download. aml this number is fixed, which may not correspond to
the truth.
This fix corrects all regions in the custom DDT to the values in bios DSDT, and thus the mask
<key>Fixes</key>
<dict>
<key>FixRegions</key>
<true/>
</dict>
is a sufficient mask if you have a well-made DSDT with all your necessary fixes.
There is another patch, but it concerns not DSDT, but in general all ACPI tables, and takes place
here illegally.
FixHeaders
It will check the headlines notonly DSDT, but all ACPI tables in general, solving the problem of
Chinese characters in the names of tables that MAKOS does not tolerate, immediately
panicking.
127
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Choosing patches
How to choose which patches are needed, which are harmless and which are dangerous?
You can try and download with the current mask. In order not to interfere with the real,
patched DDDT, already present in the system, you can specify in the menu
DSDT name: BIOS.aml
Without finding such a file, the system will take the OEM DSDT from BIOS and make fixes
over it, according to the installed mask. If you fail after you reboot your computer, the current
installations will be lost, and the default installations that you have will be able to install will
takeeffect.
The 0xFFFFFFFF mask corresponds to the inclusion of all fixes, and if the OS then loads,
the work of programmers is well spent. According to the description above, you have already
realized that some fixes you just do not need (for example WIFI). Since the 1992 audit, work has
been done to prevent panic on the double patch, So don't be afraid to ask extra bits. Two fixes at the
moment I wouldn't recommend using: FIX_SATA, bit 0x0400, it's better to use a binary cupcake
patch, and FIX_SHUTDOWN, bits AddMCHC_0008 0x04, andthe bo instead of it almost always
works installationHaltEnabler'true, working more correctly.
To see how the DSDT patches affected the result, the pre-life,you couldn't load, you can
prescribe in the confit, in the ACPI section, the following key:
<key>DSDT</key>
<dict>
<key>Debug</key>
<true/>
At the same time, two files in the folder will be saved before the system starts
/EFI/CLOVER/ACPI/origin/
DSDT-or.aml
DSDT-pa15.aml
origin is your DSDT loaded from the disk, or taken from BIOS, before the patches are applied.
patched - after applying patches.
Since you haven't been able to download, you'll also make more attempts, and patched files will be
numbered sequentially without mashing up old information. 15 in this case is the 15th download
attempt, apparently successful, you need to see what the problem of the 14th attempt was.
Still, I recommend avoiding the double patch. There may also be a situation where a double patch
occurs because OEM DSDT already has a method _DSM when we want to insize our own. So
you need to put up the DropOEM_DSM masked bit → →s.
→ DropOEM_DSM. No, you need to rename all OEM DSM.
Hand editing DSDT
Prerequisites
You need to have a computer with some kind of operating system so you can edit text
files. Or you've already put macOS on this computer somehow, and now you want to improve
DSDT.
128
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
For any operating system there is a compiler of the command line iasl. Including for
Windows, iasl.exe runs in a command line as in a poppy, has the same functions, and gives the
same results. Editing texts in Windes is inconvenient, notepad has no backlit syntax and
numbering lines, it's best to take Notepad.
For Windows, visit acpica.org Windows Binary Tools
You should also stock up on the description of the language of the APPI ACPI_6_2.pdf. It is better
to take a new version, because you need to deal with the fact of DDDT that you slipped a fresh
BIOS.
Creating a blank
First, make yourself a flash drive with Clover, boot, even without the system. It is
important that it is in the FAT32 format. We load on this computer from this flash drive to the
Clover interface. We go to the SECTION ACPI-qgt; there we find DSDT Name: and enter
BIOS.aml. This is exactly the DSDT that you could get in the winds through Aida. We go
down the menu and choose DSDT fixes - there you can put ticks, clavoy or mouse. We put almost
all the ticks that do not cause you rejection.For example, do not need Firewire, Airport, IDE if
you know that you do not have such devices. All the unfamiliar is better to put.
You come back from this substitution, and press consecutively the keys F2, F4, F5.
You can turn off the subject and carry the flash drive to the computer where you edit the files.
EFI\CLOVER\ACPI\origi
n EFI\CLOVER\misc
We copy these folders into our work folder on a computer where there is iasl. At least with Mac, at
least with Winda.
Decompilation
The resulting DSDT.aml has a binary file, its text editor will not look. I categorically do
not advise specialized editors maciASL, DSDTEditor and the like, because the purpose of the
topic is not that a good uncle rehab for you will do everything, but thatwould see for himself what
and how happens.
We run the command line: cmd.exe in the wind, terminal.app in the poppy that there in
Linux does not know, kind of bash called.
cd Workpka/origin
I'm going to go to the same copy of the folder that was taken off the thumbdrive.exe.
$ sudo cp ~/Downloads/iasl /usr/local/bin/
129
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Now, finally, you can decompyl, that is, get DSDT in a readable language.
$ iasl -da SSDT*.aml DSDT-*.aml
Option -da makes a magic thing, it searches for symbols at once on all files, so that in the end there
should be no unknown characters. However, this is ideal. In practice it doesn't work, we get a lot of
errors like AE_ALREADY_EXISTS
~~~
Firmware Error (ACPI): Failure creating named object [IO1B], AE_ALREADY_EXISTS (20200925/ dswload-495)
ACPI Error: AE_ALREADY_EXISTS, During name lookup/catalog (20200925/psobject-372) Could not parse external
ACPI tables, AE_ALREADY_EXISTS
~~~
The other option is more successful
iasl -e SSDT*.aml -d DSDT-*.aml
We have a warning on the way out
Parsing completed
Warning - Emitting ASL code "External (BNUM)"
This is a conflicting declaration with some other declaration within the ASL
code.
file.
This external declaration may need to be deleted in order to recompile the dsl
That is, in the received DSDT.dsl will have to remove the ad
External (BNUM, UnknownObj) // Conflicts with a later declaration
Because there is an ad
Field (GNVS, AnyAcc, Lock, Preserve)
{
...
BNUM, 8,
That is, the name is announced here, and it is not necessary to call it external, and even
unknown. But there are still mistakes
External (_PR_. CFGD, UnknownObj)
However, this variable is and is described in one of the SSDT. Thedecoma of the prill is still defective.
We decompile the DSDT that Clover patched us, and thus already have a lot of useful fixes.
$ iasl -da SSDT*.aml DSDT.aml
And to be able to compare what happened and what became. And we got a file with a long name
DSDT-1234567.dsl, you will have other numbers and letters.
1. Edited by a text editor.
2. Compiled, get DSDT.aml
compilation team
$ iasl -ta DSDT.dsl
3. We test, that is, put in the folder EFI'CLOVER'ACPI patched and start the system.
4. We return to pointat 1.
130
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Unfortunately, the compilation may end with the next error
Code:
This means that the description of the C3ST symbol was met in two different SSDT, the last of
which is the SSDT-10x.
In my case, it was similar to the SSDT-5x, different in that 5x is ACPI1.0, and 10x is ACPI2.0. And
the names are the same! That's something in my kernel-logo,something like that.
Also in the laptop two identical tables. I traced them to both of them in BIOS, it's not
my fault.
What to do? Before compiling remove the understudy, and in real work to make in the configa
Clover drop extra tables.
What to fix
1. Syntax errors made by the manufacturer of this computer
2. Meaning errors
3. Tricks found on the internet. No, the first two points are important, too.
Syntax errors
We watch the DSDT.dsl file itself and see the first problems in the file itself
External (_SB_. PCI0. PEG0. VID_. LCD_, UnknownObj)
This means that somewhere in the text there is a reference to the object, and the object itself is
nowhere to be found. It's in SSDT-7. It turns out that it was not exported from there. A
simple copy of the text, from that SSDT from the first curly brace to the last in the tail of
DSDT.dsl before the last bracket.
Second bug with missing characters
External (HNOT, MethodObj) // Warning: Unknown method, guessing 1 arguments
The search shows that the method is mentioned in this design code:
Input file SSDT-10x.aml, Length 0x37F (895) bytes
ACPI: SSDT 0x0000000000000000 00037F (v02 PmRef Cpu0Cst
00003001 INTL 20120913)
Pass 1 parse of [SSDT]
ACPI Error: [C3ST] Namespace lookup failure, AE_ALREADY_EXISTS
(20160729/dswload-462)
ACPI Exception: AE_ALREADY_EXISTS, During name lookup/catalog
(20160729/psobject-310)
Could not parse external ACPI tables, AE_ALREADY_EXISTS
131
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Then everything is fine, if the method is uncertain, then it is not performed. I don't understand
how it's compiled then. It is better to remove it, leave only Notify...
I'm compiling a file that I've just received (I renamed DSDT-1F2C3B4D.dsl into a simpler
DSDT1.dsl as the first attempt)
$ iasl -ta DSDT1.dsl
1 errors, 14 warnings, 91 remarks, 109 optimisations
The error must be corrected, otherwise there is no result.
Varnings also needs to be corrected, thinking about why the compiler swears.
This is still a good situation, I met and hundreds of errors at the first compilation.
In this case, the error is non-critical, in the line
Name (_HID, "*pnp0c14")
the format of the line of characters is unacceptable, corrected by science as:
Name (_HID, EisaId ("PNP0C14") /* Windows Management Instrumentation Device */)
It is necessary to correct, otherwise we do not compile, but it does not affect the work, it is a
vindus gadget.
The wrinthsare more critical, here are the corrections.
- that was
What did you do?
- CreateDWordField (BUF0, \_SB. PCI0._Y0F._LEN, MSLN) // _LEN: Length
+ CreateQWordField (BUF0, \_SB. PCI0._Y0F._LEN, MSLN) // _LEN: Length
The tip was in the compilation log
ResourceTag larger then field (size mismatch tag 64bit, Field 32 bit)
The rule is simple, tag is what you need, field - what needs to be corrected
tag=1 => CreateBitField tag=8 =>
CreateByteField tag=16 =>
CreateWordField tag=32 =>
CreateDWordField tag=64 =>
CreateQWordField
It is necessary to correct, so that in real work the sent valuee did not come to the next field.
Such a warning
Not all control path return a value
Logic error, the method should return something, and it turns out that in some cases
If (CondRefOf (HNOT))
{
HNOT (Arg0)
}
Else
{
Notify (GFX0, 0x80) // Status Change
}

theadequacy do not wait. Return or Return (Local0)?
To calm down the compiler, it will come down, and in general you need to look logic.

The code is such
Code:

read what it should do. There is no return of values there.
So let's redo it this way
Code:
That seems to be more logical.

Name (_T_0, Zero)
Use of compiler reserved name _T_0
The new iasl compiler is well versed with this design, and there is no need to do anything. The old
compiler required renaming TT_0

External (CFGD, IntObj)

Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
A common mistake is OEM methods _DSM.
It's not a manufacturer's fault, it's what he wrote under Windowes, and we have hackintosh.
Example
Code:
- Method (_DSM, 4, Serialized) // _DSM: Device-Specific Method
{
- Name (_T_0, Zero) // _T_x: Emitted by ASL
Compiler
bd0c-ba90a1ec72f8"))
If (Arg0 == ToUUID ("a5fc708f-8775-4ba6-
{
While (One)
{
See UUID? It's from the Windies registry, there's no such thing in Mack, and nothing's going
to happen.
That would be half of trouble, but if it's okay for the Windies to have _DSM for both the device and
his bridge, then in Mack it causes a crash.
We kill all other people's _DSM! Simple variant
Code:
The method itself has survived, but no one will turn to it, and there will be no panic.
Here's such a curious piece
Code:
Looking closer to the address, I realized that it is Function Disable Bit.
The point of the operation is that for systems lower than Windows Vista to ban USB3.
I think this piece should be cut out at all.
And this is already a snuggle of writers
Code:
If ((OSYS > 0x07D0) || (OSYS < 0x07D6))
The ranges add up and overlap in general any value of theSKR there
should be
Code:
If ((OSYS > 0x07D0) && (OSYS < 0x07D6))
Name (PDC3, 0x80000000) Name
(PDC4, 0x80000000) Name
(PDC5, 0x80000000) Name
(PDC6, 0x80000000) Name
(PDC7, 0x80000000)
Name (SDTL, Zero)
+
+
+
+
+

+ Method (ZDSM, 4, Serialized)
OperationRegion (DXHC, SystemMemory, 0xFED1F418, 0x04) XHCD,

}
If ((OSYS < 0x07D6) && (OSYS > 0x03E8))
{
XHCD = One
Notify (XHC, Zero) // Bus Check

134
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Then the ranges intersect.
But then you need to look at what's in If, and what's in Else.
I've got what's right in Then, so the original design
Code:
I've reduced to one operator at all.
Notify (PCI0, Arg1)
The fact is that this If poverdrive is whether the WindowsXP system is doing what Else does in
Then, for systems like Windows7,8.10.
What's the difference? Optimus works in the new systems.
In macOS, we need first-class notification, the entire tire.
A little detective story on the topic, maybe someone will lead to the right idea.
The laptop sleeps and wakes up if it is not inserted into the socket. But then the battery
sits down.
So, look for what distinguishes the ACPI state in the outlet and no.
Code:
The decompanist helpfully told us that this is the power supply.
The _PSR method determines whether the device is a food source or resting.
Code:
You can read about it in the book ACPIspec.pdf, any year of publication
An Integer containing the power source status
If ((OSYS > 0x07D0) || (OSYS < 0x07D6))
{
Notify (PCI0, Arg1)
}
Else
{
Notify (GFX0, Arg1)
}
Device (AC)
{
Name (_HID, "ACPI0003" /* Power Source Device */) //
_HID: Hardware ID
Method (_PSR, 0, NotSerialized) _PSR: Power
Source
{
Local0 = ECG5 ()
Local0 &= One
If (Local0 != PWRS)
{
PWRS = Local0
PNOT ()
}
Return (Local0)
}
135
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
That's is, in my case some way. Hard-backed Method ECG5 () issues Some number, in Which bit 0
means sticking in Socket.
And saves in the PWRS variable if there the value is different.
Now we look all over the code where PWRS is mentioned and find in the _PTS method (Prepare To
Sleep), in the same one that is responsible for falling asleep.
Code:
Interestingly here!
Condition: if the device is not stuck in the socket, then something to do in THE USB2
and USB3. And if they do, they don't need anything.
In the log of unexpected awakening we see XHC, EHC2.
That is, the creators of this DDDT believe that the laptop can be stuck in the socket only while
working. Otherwise, pull it out.
By removing this If condition, I got a solution to my problem. Now my laptop sleeps and wakes up,
and the power adapter doesn't bother him.
Success in creating the minimum correct DSDT!
Native speedstep
It is better to say the Power and Frequency Of Processor (UPI) -- in English it will be EIST -
Enhanced Intel Speedstep Technology, from where the Russian word "Speedstep" will be.
Method (_PTS, 1, NotSerialized) _PTS: Prepare To Sleep
{
P80D = Zero
P8XH (Zero, Arg0) PTS
(Arg0)
If (AOAC & One) {} If
(Arg0 == 0x03)
{
If (PWRS == Zero)
{
\_SB. PCI0. XHC. PMEB = Zero
\_SB. PCI0. EHC1. PMEB = Zero
\_SB. PCI0. EHC2. PMEB = Zero
If (\_SB. PCI0. XHC. PMST == One)
{
\_SB. PCI0. XHC. PMST = One
}
If (\_SB. PCI0. EHC1. PMST == One)
{
\_SB. PCI0. EHC1. PMST = One
}
If (\_SB. PCI0. EHC2. PMST == One)
{
\_SB. PCI0. EHC2. PMST = One
}
}
0 – Off-line (not on AC power) 1
– On-line
136
Clover-colored khaki. Version 5.1, Audit 5128
Moscow, 2021
Actually, this theme is not so much fordownloading the chik, as in general to set up the Hackos,
but since Clover makes some steps, we will describe a separate chapter.
Clover does not do everything you need, it is necessary and a little work with his hands.
What is it for? The point is this: the processor in inactivity works at a minimum frequency
with minimal voltage, under load speed and voltage grow. (And why the tension?
UPIP canbe implemented in two ways: a specialized utility, such as KulBukController, or
General Cpap, or to understand the native speedstep, the benefit of MACOS is able to do it.
The following steps are needed:
1. The DDDT must be corrected by HPET, which is successfully done by Clover
with a 0x0010 mask.
2. There should be the right processor section, which is done by Clover on the
generatePStates-Yes key (and in addition DropSsdt)
3. MacModel should be selected as a sample of your SMBIOS, for which EIST
technology is provided. It turns out, not for all models.
Paragraph 3 can be rethought as follows: let the model be more similar in configuration to the
present, but we will correct its platform-plist so that the speedstep appeared.
For each model there is a plist, see here
System/Library/Extensions/IOPlatformPluginFamily.kext/Contents/PlugIns/
ACPI_SMC_PlatformPlugin.kext/Contents/Resources/MacBook5_1.plist
We look at the similarities and differences of different plists, and correct ours in the right direction.
ConfigArray
<key>ConfigArray</key>
<array>
<dict>
<key>WWEN</key>
<true/>
<key>model</key>
<string>MacBook4,1</string>
<key>restart-action</key>
<dict>
<key>cpu-p-state</key>
<integer>0</integer>
</dict>
</dict>
</array>
This restart-action key means which P-State should fall off the CPU when restarting. Only if you
have this key have earned sleep and turn off the computer!
CtrlLoopArray
<key>CtrlLoopArray</key>
<array>
<dict>
<key>Description</key>
<string>SMC_CPU_Control_Loop</string>
...
<
k
e
y

i
m

/

>
